trans-unit.source: Specifies the style for the pager of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The pager is an element on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control that allows you to link to other pages when paging is enabled.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.PagerStyle%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control uses an instance of this class to represent the style properties for the pager.
For more information on paging, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowPaging%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowCustomPaging%2A>.
Copies the style of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object into this instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle"></xref> class.

Use the CopyFrom method to copy the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object into this instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle> class.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> to copy from.
Merges the style of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object with this instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle"></xref> class.

Use the MergeWith method to combine the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with this instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle> class.
If a property from this instance is already set to a value, the property is unchanged.
If a property is not set, this method sets that property with the value from the corresponding property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> to merge with.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the pager element displays buttons that link to the next and previous page, or numeric buttons that link directly to a page.
Use the Mode property to specify which set of pager buttons to use on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
You can specify buttons that link to the next and previous page, or numeric buttons that link directly to a page.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerMode"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_NextPrev" name="NextPrev" href=""></xref>.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerMode"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the text displayed for the next page button.
Use the NextPageText property to provide custom text for the next page button.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property must be set to `PagerMode.NextPrev` for this property to have any effect.

This property is used along with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.PrevPageText%2A> property to create a custom set of controls for the next and previous buttons of the pager on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not automatically encode special characters to HTML.
You need to convert these characters to the appropriate HTML value.
For example the greater than sign (>) will not automatically convert to `>`.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The text to display for the next page button.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_"&gt;"" name=""&gt;"" href=""></xref>, which is rendered as the greater than sign (>).
The specified value is less than <xref uid="langword_csharp_1" name="1" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the number of numeric buttons to display concurrently in the pager element of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
Use the PageButtonCount property to specify the number of numeric buttons to display concurrently in the pager element of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property must be set to `PagerMode.NumericPages` for this property to have any effect.
If there are more pages in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control than specified in this property, ellipsis buttons (...) are displayed in the pager element.
When clicked, these buttons display the next or previous set of numeric buttons.
The number of numeric buttons to display concurrently in the pager element of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_10" name="10" href=""></xref>.
The selected value is less than <xref uid="langword_csharp_1" name="1" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the position of the pager element in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
Use the Position property to specify the location where the pager element is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
The pager element can be displayed at the upper edge, the lower edge, or at both the upper and lower edges of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Bottom" name="Bottom" href=""></xref>.
The specified value is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagerPosition"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the text displayed for the previous page button.
Use the PrevPageText property to provide custom text for the next page button.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.Mode%2A> property must be set to `PagerMode.NextPrev` for this property to have any effect.

This property is used along with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle.NextPageText%2A> property to create a custom appearance for the next and previous buttons of the pager on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not automatically encode special characters to HTML.
You need to convert special characters to the appropriate HTML value.
For example, the greater than sign (>) will not automatically convert to `>`.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The text to display for the previous page button.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_"&lt;"" name=""&lt;"" href=""></xref>, which is rendered as the less than sign (<).
Restores the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle"></xref> object to its default values.
Use the Reset method to restore the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridPagerStyle> object to its default values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the pager is displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
Use the Visible property to specify whether the pager is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to display the pager; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
